com.davidbracewell.hermes

Class Annotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.davidbracewell.hermes.Span
      • com.davidbracewell.hermes.HString
        • com.davidbracewell.hermes.Annotation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AnnotatedObject, AttributedObject, RelationalObject, Serializable, CharSequence, Comparable<Span>

    public final class Annotation
extends HString
implements Serializable

    Associates a type, e.g. token, sentence, named entity, and a set of attributes, e.g. part of speech and entity type, to a specific span of a document, which may include the entire document. Annotation type information is defined via the AnnotationType class.

    Commonly, annotations have an associated Tag attribute which acts as label. Examples of tags include part-of-speech and entity type. Tags can be retrieved using the getTag() method. Annotation types specify the attribute that represents the tag of an annotation of its type (in some cases annotations may have multiple tags and this definition allows the primary tag to specified). If no tag is specified, a default attribute of TAG.

    Author:
    David B. Bracewell
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Gets the unique id associated with the annotation.
        Returns:
        the id of the annotation that is unique with in its document or Annotation.DETACHED_ID if the annotation is not attached to the document.

      • getTag

        public Optional<com.davidbracewell.Tag> getTag()

        Gets the tag, if one, associated with the annotation. The tag attribute is defined for an annotation type using the tag configuration property, e.g. Annotation.TYPE.tag=fully.qualified.tag.implementation. Tags must implement the Tag interface. If no tag type is defined, the Attrs.TAG attribute will be retrieved.

        Returns:
        An optional containing the tag if present
